job_description: AI/ML Intern (Full Time - Paid Internship) Location: Remote. Experience: 0-1 year. Start Date: Immediate / As per availability. Stipend: Competitive. About SolvusAI: SolvusAI is a fast-growing AI consulting and solutioning firm helping global enterprises unlock the power of Generative AI and Machine Learning to solve real business problems. We work across industries to deliver high-impact AI strategies, advisory, and implementation solutions that create tangible value. At SolvusAI, we value curiosity, ownership, and adaptability. Whether it's through rapid prototyping, cloud-native architectures, or cutting-edge LLMs, we believe in moving fast and building smart. Join us, and be part of a collaborative, future-focused team that’s redefining what AI can do for the enterprise. Are you driven by curiosity and a passion for AI, Gen-AI, and data-driven innovation? Do you want to work at the forefront of AI development - building intelligent agents, optimizing scalable workflows, and applying cutting-edge models to real-world challenges? Key Responsibilities: Design and implement scalable, maintainable, and robust AI/ML systems. Build and fine-tune ML/DL models using core concepts like feature engineering, model evaluation, and architecture selection (e.g., CNNs, Transformers) to solve business problems. Work on agentic workflows and intelligent orchestration of LLMs using tools like LangChain or Semantic Kernel. Design and deploy RESTful APIs for AI services and intelligent pipelines. Integrate and evaluate vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Chroma, Pinecone) with LLMs for RAG-based systems. Validate and monitor AI models through rigorous testing (unit, integration, adversarial) ensuring generalization and fairness. Identify and mitigate risks related to bias, drift, and hallucinations in generative models. Deploy solutions to cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) using CI/CD principles. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into AI-first solutions. Must-Have Skills & Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in engineering/technology. Final year engineering students with relevant skillsets and bandwidth can also apply. 0-1 year of industry experience in AI/ML development. Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in FastAPI. Good understanding of core ML/DL concepts: supervised/unsupervised learning, overfitting, regularization, CNNs, Transformers, etc. Experience with SQL and basic data engineering principles. Familiarity with foundational Gen-AI concepts (e.g., embeddings, prompting, fine-tuning) and models (ChatGPT, LLaMA 2/3, Mistral, Claude, etc.). Exposure to frameworks like LangChain or LlamaIndex. Understanding of agent-based workflows and AI task automation. Analytical mindset and strong debugging/problem-solving skills. Good communication and collaboration abilities in a remote work environment. Preferred Skills: Knowledge of RLHF, prompt engineering, few-shot learning. Experience with data labelling, evaluation frameworks, and synthetic data generation. Understanding of monitoring tools for model performance, latency, and observability. Working knowledge of cloud deployments and containerization (Docker, basic Kubernetes is a plus). Why Join SolvusAI? Work at the cutting edge of applied AI and Gen-AI. Collaborate with a high-energy, impact-driven team. Flexible remote environment. Ownership and visibility across projects from day one. Opportunity to shape the future of intelligent automation. How to Apply: Send us your resume and a short note on why you're interested in this role to careers@solvusai.com after applying on LinkedIn.
Build MVP from scratch in 2 months. Work on real product launch. India’s Auto-Rickshaw Ride-Hailing App for Tier 2 & Tier 3 Cities.
experience_required: Final-year students or recent grads preferred

job_description: AI/ML Intern (Remote) – AgentCrafters.ai.  Internship with potential for a full-time offer.  Work on prototyping, testing, and deploying ML workflows; training and evaluating classical ML models; building simple NLP/computer vision applications; supporting development of AI agents using tools like OpenAI, LangChain, and other LLM frameworks; performing data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model tuning; documenting experiments and contributing to the product's intelligence layer.  Remote-first internship with flexible hours, real-world projects, fast-track to a full-time role, 1-on-1 mentorship, letter of recommendation & internship certificate.
Build MVP from scratch in 2 months. Work on real product launch. India’s Auto-Rickshaw Ride-Hailing App for Tier 2 & Tier 3 Cities.

job_description: The Artificial Intelligence team at QpiAI is building the next frontier of AI-driven edge intelligence—powering smart devices, real-time perception systems, and decentralized learning pipelines for industry-grade applications. From Agentic AI to Computer Vision and model optimization for edge hardware, we are designing cutting-edge solutions to push AI inference beyond the cloud. If you’re excited by the idea of bringing Large Models to Tiny Devices, we want to hear from you. We’re hiring Edge AI Interns to work alongside our product and engineering teams. You will be contributing to: Edge AI model optimization, quantization, and ONNX conversion; Edge deployment workflows (e.g., Android/Linux) using Docker and Kubernetes; Real-time inference for CV and NLP applications on resource-constrained devices; Prototyping and testing model performance across ARM/NPU/EdgeTPU platforms; Integrating with QpiAI Pro and Agent Hive pipelines for edge-to-cloud AI orchestration.
2-month internship openings at FoundrFlow, a youth-led startup community.  Work with a dynamic startup team, gain hands-on experience, and build your portfolio. Remote/Hybrid.

job_description: Build MVP from scratch in 2 months. Work on real product launch. Final-year students or recent grads preferred.

🚀 Edge AI Intern – Intelligence at the Edge | QpiAI

The Artificial Intelligence team at QpiAI is building the next frontier of AI-driven edge intelligence—powering smart devices, real-time perception systems, and decentralized learning pipelines for industry-grade applications.

From Agentic AI to Computer Vision and model optimization for edge hardware, we are designing cutting-edge solutions to push AI inference beyond the cloud. If you’re excited by the idea of bringing Large Models to Tiny Devices, we want to hear from you.


🔍 Who We’re Looking For

We’re hiring Edge AI Interns to work alongside our product and engineering teams. You will be contributing to:

Edge AI model optimization, quantization, and ONNX conversion
Edge deployment workflows (e.g., Android/Linux) using Docker and Kubernetes
Real-time inference for CV and NLP applications on resource-constrained devices
Prototyping and testing model performance across ARM/NPU/EdgeTPU platforms
Integrating with QpiAI Pro and Agent Hive pipelines for edge-to-cloud AI orchestration


💡 Ideal Candidate Traits

First principles thinker with a passion for AI at the edge
Strong problem-solving skills and curiosity for optimization trade-offs
Hands-on, self-motivated, and eager to experiment and iterate


✅ Key Requirements

Solid Python skills with deep learning libraries (PyTorch, TensorFlow, ONNX, TorchVision, OpenCV)
Familiarity with model quantization, pruning, and export formats (TorchScript, ONNX)
Deep understanding of edge computing environments (e.g.,Jetson, ARM, Raspberry Pi)
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Linux terminal
Exposure to MLOps tools and model orchestration frameworks
Strong fundamentals in ML, DL, CNNs, and Transformer architectures
Understanding of Version Control Systems, Workflow Orchestration, CI/CD pipeline
Recent graduate or student in Computer Science, ECE, or AI-focused programs (IITs/NITs preferred)


🌟 Bonus Skills (Good to Have)

Knowledge of low-level optimizations (TVM, TensorRT, TFLite, OpenVINO)
Familicity with MQTT, MinIO, or similar edge communication protocols
Experience with edge inference on audio, video, or multi-modal datasets
Exposure to LangGraph, LangFlow, or multi-agent frameworks
